meanings.definition: To use trickery or deception in order to achieve one's goals.
meanings.sent1: She chicaned her way into getting the last piece of cake.
meanings.sent2: The con artist chicaned his victims out of their money.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon chicaned the other animals into thinking there was a feast.
meanings.sent4: Her smile chicaned him into believing her lies.
meanings.sent5: The magician chicaned the audience with his disappearing act.

meanings.definition: To engage in clever but dishonest behavior.
meanings.sent1: He chicaned his opponents during the game to gain an unfair advantage.
meanings.sent2: The swindler chicaned his way through various scams.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky fox chicaned the hens out of their eggs.
meanings.sent4: Her words chicaned their trust in her sincerity.
meanings.sent5: The cunning thief chicaned the security guards and escaped unnoticed.

meanings.sent1: The fraudster chicaned innocent people into investing in a fake company.
meanings.sent2: She chicaned her friend into believing she had won the lottery.
meanings.sent3: The sly cat chicaned the birds into coming closer with false promises.
meanings.sent4: His smooth talk chicaned many into buying unnecessary products.
meanings.sent5: The illusionist chicaned the audience with his mind-bending tricks.
